explains: n. 民粹主义，平民主义

sentences.en: There is more than a dash of populism behind Ms Reding's attack on the industry.
sentences.cn: 但是Reding女士对于这个行业的抨击得到相当多大众的欢迎。

sentences.en: Yet Britain is guilty of populism too, says a diplomat from a normally supportive country.
sentences.cn: 但是一位外交官说，英国对于民意论也有责任要负，他的国家通常情况下都站在支持一方。

sentences.en: This new trend, dubbed "Tech Populism" by Forrester Research, is referring to the new user base of digitally savvy workers.
sentences.cn: 这种新的趋势来源于佛瑞斯特调研公司的“技术纯粹主义”，指的是让熟悉计算机技术的员工自己选择使用的工具。
